quizzes.title: Nature Quiz: Cat and Cats
quizzes.description: Test your nature knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Nature, phrase, cats. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Male turkeys are monogamous and will stay with one female for life.
On what continent can aardvarks be found?
A cats sense of hearing is much more sensitive than that of a human or a dog.
Indoor cats tend to live longer.
What year was the very first cat show held?
Are aardvarks an endangered species?
Finish this old phrase:
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: takes a message

questions.question: Did all Indian tribes of North America eat turkeys or consider them to be edible?
Which of these is not one of the most popular names for female cats in the USA?
Which type of cat is almost always female?
How fast can a domestic cat sprint?
Cats have 517 of these in their entire body.
Which of these statements if true about a cat?

options.text: Their urine glows under a black light.
Normal body temperature for a a cat is 95 degrees Fahrenheit.
They take about 50 breaths per minute.
They walk on the bottoms of their feet.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Their urine glows under a black light.

questions.question: The nose pad of a cat is unique like the human fingerprint.
According to a survey, what percentage of American cat owners admit to blow drying their feline after giving it a bath?

quizzes.title: Nature Quiz: Aardvark and Dolphin
quizzes.description: Test your nature knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Nature, pink, period. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What year was named by the United Nations as the Year of the Dolphin?
Are all dolphins considered whales?
Aardvark is a word coming from the Afrikaans/Dutch that literally translates as what?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Earth Pig

questions.question: The Orca (Killer Whale) is the largest species of dolphin.
How many young can an adult aardvark have at one time?
What is the scientific name for an aardvark?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Orycteropus afer

questions.question: What is the gestation period of a dolphin?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Varies by species

questions.question: Aardvarks have more olfactory nerves than other mammals.
Are aardvarks nocturnal animals?
Which one of these statements about aardvarks is false?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Aardvarks only eat termites.

questions.question: Which of these is NOT a species of dolphin?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Eastern Dolphin

questions.question: What color was the aardvark from the Pink Panther cartoon?
What is the gestation period for an aardvark?
Dolphins are only found in the ocean.
Approximately, how many species of dolphins exist?

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Badgers and Raccoon
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, world, part. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Can you find badgers in Europe?
How many young can an adult badger have at one time?
Which of these is not a part of the badgers diet?
Which of the following octopuses could most easily kill a human?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Blue Ringed Octopus

questions.question: Badgers like to use one den all year round.
Are badgers the largest native carnivores found in the UK?
What is the scientific name of the Common Raccoon?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Procyon lotor

questions.question: Where in the world can you find the dolphin known as the Boto?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: South America

questions.question: Is the raccoon native to Europe?
How many hearts do most octopi have?
In Toronto, Canada the raccoon has become a great urban pest, only exceeded by the Gray Squirrel.
Which of these in NOT a species of raccoon?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Tree Raccoon

questions.question: The badger can be found in every part of the lower 48 states.
The expression badgering someone” came from the cruel sport of badger baiting.
Are badgers related to weasels?

quizzes.title: Nature Quiz: Smilodon and Octopus
quizzes.description: Test your nature knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Nature, frog, best. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Tomato Frogs existence is threatened due to what reason?

options.text: Their legs are used for food in fine dining restaurants.
They are hunted for their oils that are used as a skin moisturizer.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Habitat destruction

questions.question: What king of habitat do Tomato Frogs live in?

options.text: in marshes, shallow pools, flooded meadows, and wetlands
in dessert areas that are very arid and dry

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: in marshes, shallow pools, flooded meadows, and wetlands

questions.question: Which of the following words is NOT related to the octopus?
Which of the following octopi has the scientific name Enteroctopus Dofleini?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Giant Pacific Octopus

questions.question: The octopus is considered the smartest invertebrate.
Is it believed that Smilodon was a social animal?
Which of the following best defines the octopus related word midden?

options.text: a burrow in the sand used as a den
a hole in the rock face or corral used as a den
a chemical in the ink sprayed from an octopus siphon

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: a pile of shells

questions.question: Which of the following is the name for an octopuss tongue?
Which species of Smilodon was the largest?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Smilodon populator

questions.question: Octopi live alone all their lives except when mating.
Octopuses have excellent vision. Which of the following statements about an octopuss vision is NOT true?

options.text: They can see well at night.
They can make out size and shape very well.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: They can see in color.

questions.question: How much could a full-grown Smilodon weigh?
What two continents did Smilodon inhabit?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: North and South America

questions.question: The Tomato Frog is native to the eastern coast of Madagascar.
Approximately how long ago did Smilodon become extinct?

quizzes.title: Nature Quiz: Manatees and Tomato Frogs
quizzes.description: Test your nature knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Nature, frog, weight. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Some animals have an inborn instinct to swallow gastroliths in order to improve the breaking down of food inside their stomachs. What kind of objects are gastroliths?

options.text: Plants that are rich in digestive enzymes

questions.question: Tomato Frogs lay their eggs in the water during rainy seasons.
Male Tomato Frogs are bright red.
Which of these do manatees use to communicate with their calves and other manatees?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: Tomato Frogs tend to hit sexual maturity in about 9-14 months.
The manatee is a marine mammal.
When Tomato Frogs are in captivity at a zoo, what kind of food are they fed?

options.text: Small fish, such as minnows and guppies
The same food they would eat in the wild

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Vitamin-dusted crickets and mealworms.

questions.question: The life span of a Tomato Frog is 15-35 years.
Parthenogenesis (from Greek - virgin creation), an asexual way of reproduction without the need of fertilization, occurs naturally in these animals.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: The manatee has a tail similar in shape to that of the dolphin.
When the Tomato Frog is threatened its skin secretes a thick substance containing a toxin.
Manatees range in weight from 900 to 1200 pounds (400-550 kg.)
Female Tomato Frogs are larger than male Tomato Frogs.
Manatees are found more commonly in Caribbean, Mexico, and Florida waters. Why?

options.text: There is a better food variety.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The water is warm.

questions.question: Due to the presence of a specific protein in the blood plasma octopuses have this unusual blood color.

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Fish and Air
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, kind, creatures. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What kind of respiratory organs do lungfish have?

options.text: They have both lungs and gills.
Lungfish do not have any respiratory organs. They absorb oxygen through their skin.
They do not have gills, they use their lungs for respiration.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: They have both lungs and gills.

questions.question: This fish, which resembles the Angel fish, is recognized by its brightly coloured and patterned body, as well as by the dark band across its eyes.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Butterfly fish

questions.question: Which of  the following statements is true about mosquitoes?

options.text: All mosquitoes on the planet drink blood.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Only female mosquitoes suck blood.

questions.question: The zebrafish (Girella zebra), which can be recognised by its pale body and yellow fins, is endemic to which region?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Australian waters

questions.question: Cockroaches are among the most resilient creatures on our planet. But how long can they survive without air?
This primitive shark, with a brown thin eel-like body, has six pairs of gill slits and trident-like teeth.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Frilled shark

questions.question: Human skin has the unique ability to acquire a darker shade when exposed to UV-rays. What animals share this ability with us?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Pigs and hammerhead sharks

questions.question: Koalas almost exclusively feed on this type of food.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Eucalyptus leaves

questions.question: What is the other name of Mola mola, a fish generally considered to be the most massive bony fish in the world?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ocean Sunfish

questions.question: Which of the following statements is true about snails?

options.text: Snails do not have any teeth or tooth-like formations.
Snails have real teeth very similar to those of mammals.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Snails do have tooth-like formations.

questions.question: The Parrot fish, found in the Atlantic Indian and Pacific Ocean reefs, was given its name for what reason?

options.text: Because of the shape of its body
Because it can fly a few metres above water
Because its body is in different flashy colours

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Because of its beak-like mouth

questions.question: When threatened, this fish, also known as balloonfish, increases in size by swallowing water or air.
The Mimic Leatherjacket, found in the tropical marine waters throughout the Indo-Pacific, mimics which poisonous fish?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Saddled Puffer

questions.question: The Flashlight fish, has a light-producing organ, which contains luminescent bacteria. Where is this organ located?

options.text: On the dorsal fin of the fish
Below the eye of the fish
Above the eye of the fish
Between the eyes of the fish

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Below the eye of the fish

questions.question: Some sharks hardly ever stop swimming during their whole existence. What is the reason for this?

options.text: Some sharks are very desirable hosts for small parasitic creatures. Those sharks are constantly trying to escape from them by incessant swimming.
Sharks are highly anxious and easily agitated animals. They cannot stay in the same place for more than a few seconds.
Sharks are cold-blooded animals. If they stop moving their body temperature will decrease too much and will cause hypothermia, which can be lethal.
Some sharks have lost the ability to pump water through their gills, so they need to keep moving in order to stay alive

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Some sharks have lost the ability to pump water through their gills, so they need to keep moving in order to stay alive
